channel.title: Newbie first time no-nothing Java Tutorial
channel.description:
This is a great tut i made from the tut's at java's website. I copied it into one nicely neat thread this is good for new java coders. :D
heres the contents of the page:
===[b]Index[/b]===
[b]Lessons one-three = the overview of Java[/b] ===This section provides an overview of Java technology as a whole. It discusses both the Java programming language and platform, providing a broad overview of what this technology can do and how it will make your life easier.
[b]Lesson four = The "Hello World" Application[/b] ===This hands-on approach describes what to download, what to install, and what to type, for creating a simple "Hello World" application. It provides separate instructions for Windows, UNIX/Linux, and Mac users.
[b]Lessons five-nine = A Closer Look at "Hello World"[/b] ===This section discusses the "Hello World" application, describing each section of code in detail. It covers comment formats, defining a simple class, implementing the main method, and how this appication uses classes and objects.
[b]Lesson ten = Common Problems (and Their Solutions) [/b] ===This is the place to go if you have trouble compiling or running the programs in this trail.
Lets begin!
and to read whole thing click here: [cuz too long to post here] http://goat-spirit.com/endar/index.php?topic=227

thx man u helped me allot coz i didn’t know anything about java ty
[/quote]
Nice one year old bump.[/quote]

This is an epic 19 month bump…

Read full topic

This is a great tut i made from the tut’s at java’s website. I copied it into one nicely neat thread this is good for new java coders.

heres the contents of the page:

===Index===

Lessons one-three = the overview of Java
===This section provides an overview of Java technology as a whole. It discusses both the Java programming language and platform, providing a broad overview of what this technology can do and how it will make your life easier.

Lesson four = The “Hello World” Application
===This hands-on approach describes what to download, what to install, and what to type, for creating a simple “Hello World” application. It provides separate instructions for Windows, UNIX/Linux, and Mac users.

Lessons five-nine = A Closer Look at “Hello World”
===This section discusses the “Hello World” application, describing each section of code in detail. It covers comment formats, defining a simple class, implementing the main method, and how this appication uses classes and objects.

Lesson ten = Common Problems (and Their Solutions)
===This is the place to go if you have trouble compiling or running the programs in this trail.

Lets begin!
